metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23985 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
If an attacker is able to alter specific about:config values (for example malware running on the user's computer), the Devtools remote debugging feature could have been enabled in a way that was unnoticable to the user. This would have allowed a remote attacker (able to make a direct network connection to the victim) to monitor the user's browsing activity and (plaintext) network traffic. This was addressed by providing a visual cue when Devtools has an open network socket. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 87.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
